article_title: Should Parents Pay for Their Children's College Education?
article_text:
For many families, especially those relatively well-off, the idea of who will pay for college is a given: It is the parents' responsibility.

But should it be?

On one side, parents want to give their children the best chance for a happy, financially sound future. They don't want their kids starting out in life burdened with student debt—a...

twitter.description: Linda Herman, a psychotherapist and author, says it's up to the kids to make it work. Meir Statman, a finance professor at Santa Clara University's Leavey School of Business, says this is an investment parents should make, even if it eats into retirement savings.
twitter.title: Should Parents Pay for Their Children's College Education?

image.alt: Is it a parent's responsibility to pay for their child's college tuition?
